sn6.15:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kusināra, in the sal tree forest of the Mallas at Upavattana, between the two sal trees at the time of his final extinguishment.
sn6.15:4.2: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
sn6.15:4.3: “Right now, mendicants, I say to you all:
sn6.15:4.4: ‘Conditions fall apart. Accomplish the goal with diligence.’”
sn6.15:4.5: These were the Realized One’s last words.
sn6.15:5.1: Then the Buddha entered the first absorption.
sn6.15:5.2: He emerged from that and entered the second absorption.
sn6.15:5.3: He emerged from that and entered the third absorption.
sn6.15:5.4: He emerged from that and entered the fourth absorption.
sn6.15:5.5: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of infinite space.
sn6.15:5.6: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of infinite consciousness.
sn6.15:5.7: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of nothingness.
sn6.15:5.8: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
sn6.15:5.9: He emerged from that and entered the cessation of perception and feeling.
sn6.15:6.1: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

sn6.15:6.3: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of infinite consciousness.
sn6.15:6.4: He emerged from that and entered the dimension of infinite space.
sn6.15:6.5: He emerged from that and entered the fourth absorption.

sn6.15:6.11: He emerged from that and entered the fourth absorption.
sn6.15:6.12: Having emerged from the fourth absorption, the Buddha immediately became finally extinguished.
sn6.15:6.13: When the Buddha was becoming finally extinguished, at the same time Brahmā Sahampati recited this verse:
